Key Match Events: Shaheen Afridi dismissed Andrew Balbirnie and Lorcan Tucker in the first over
Gareth Delany (31 off 19 balls) helped stabilize Ireland’s innings
Joshua Little and Benjamin White formed an unbeaten last-wicket partnership of 26 runs
Barry McCarthy (3-15) dismissed Usman Khan and Shadab Khan in the same over
Babar Azam anchored Pakistan’s innings and they chased down the target with seven balls to spare
Shaheen Afridi took the catch to dismiss Mark Adair after colliding with Usman Khan
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling: ‘We played well in patches. They blew our top order away but I’m proud of the fight that we’ve shown. We’ll go back and regroup and get better in the months and years to come.’
Babar Azam: ‘We have some close games but we didn’t finish well. We have some good individuals but we didn’t play well as a team.’
Shaheen Shah Afridi: ‘As usual I’m trying to strike early on, I followed my plan.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shaheen Shah Afridi and Usman Khan collided after dismissing Mark Adair
Pakistan needed 107 to win and chased it down with seven balls to spare
Ireland’s weather watch mentioned potential rain delays
The match was held at Lauderhill’s Central Broward Park stadium
